name: Avoid LDAP injection
associatedValueName: Call stack from user input source down to the target LDAP execution method
description: This quality rule identifies potential LDAP injection vulnerabilities by detecting unsafe data flows from user input sources to LDAP query operations. Using CAST's data-flow engine, it traces paths where untrusted user input is directly incorporated into LDAP search filters, distinguished names, or other LDAP operations without proper sanitization. The rule specifically targets methods that construct LDAP queries dynamically using concatenation or string formatting with user-controlled data.
output:
List all methods that make LDAP calls forged by user input

It provides the following information:
 - Method full name
 - Call stack from user input source down to the target LDAP execution method.
rationale:
LDAP injection consequences include:
-Unauthorized data access: attackers can bypass authentication mechanisms or access sensitive directory information
-Data manipulation: modification or deletion of directory entries
-Information disclosure: extraction of sensitive user credentials, organizational structure, or system information
-Authentication bypass: circumvention of login controls by manipulating authentication queries
-Directory traversal: access to unauthorized directory branches or organizational units
reference:
CWE-90: Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in an LDAP Query ('LDAP Injection')
https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/90.html

Open Web Application Security Project (OWASP) - OWASP Top 10:2021
https://owasp.org/Top10/fr/A03_2021-Injection/

OWASP Cheat Sheet Series - LDAP Injection Prevention Cheat Sheet
https://cheatsheetseries.owasp.org/cheatsheets/LDAP_Injection_Prevention_Cheat_Sheet.html
remediation:
-Use parameterized queries or prepared statements when available in your LDAP library
-Sanitize user input by removing or encoding LDAP metacharacters: utilize framework-provided methods that automatically handle sanitization
alternativeName: Ensure your application does not run LDAP methods without sanitization
